Indexes.Name: commit_index_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX commit_index_pkey ON commit_index USING btree (committed_at, repo_id, commit_bytea)

Indexes.Name: commit_index_repo_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX commit_index_repo_id_idx ON commit_index USING btree (repo_id, committed_at)

Indexes.Name: commit_index_metadata_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX commit_index_metadata_pkey ON commit_index_metadata USING btree (repo_id)

Columns.Name: created_at
Columns.Comment: Timestamp the dashboard was initially created.

Columns.Name: created_by_user_id
Columns.Comment: User that created the dashboard, if available.

Columns.Name: deleted_at
Columns.Comment: Set to the time the dashboard was soft deleted.

Columns.Name: last_updated_at
Columns.Comment: Time the dashboard was last updated, either metadata or insights.

Columns.Name: save
Columns.Comment: TEMPORARY Do not delete this dashboard when migrating settings.

Columns.Name: title
Columns.Comment: Title of the dashboard

Indexes.Name: dashboard_pk
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX dashboard_pk ON dashboard USING btree (id)

Tables.Name: dashboard_grants
Tables.Comment: Permission grants for dashboards. Each row should represent a unique principal (user, org, etc).

Columns.Name: global
Columns.Comment: Grant that does not belong to any specific principal and is granted to all users.

Columns.Name: org_id
Columns.Comment: Org ID that that receives this grant.

Columns.Name: user_id
Columns.Comment: User ID that that receives this grant.

Indexes.Name: dashboard_grants_pk
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX dashboard_grants_pk ON dashboard_grants USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: dashboard_grants_dashboard_id_index
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX dashboard_grants_dashboard_id_index ON dashboard_grants USING btree (dashboard_id)

Indexes.Name: dashboard_grants_global_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX dashboard_grants_global_idx ON dashboard_grants USING btree (global) WHERE global IS TRUE

Indexes.Name: dashboard_grants_org_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX dashboard_grants_org_id_idx ON dashboard_grants USING btree (org_id)

Indexes.Name: dashboard_grants_user_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX dashboard_grants_user_id_idx ON dashboard_grants USING btree (user_id)

Constraints.Name: dashboard_grants_dashboard_id_fk
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (dashboard_id) REFERENCES dashboard(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

Indexes.Name: dashboard_insight_view_pk
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX dashboard_insight_view_pk ON dashboard_insight_view USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: unique_dashboard_id_insight_view_id
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX unique_dashboard_id_insight_view_id ON dashboard_insight_view USING btree (dashboard_id, insight_view_id)

Indexes.Name: dashboard_insight_view_dashboard_id_fk_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX dashboard_insight_view_dashboard_id_fk_idx ON dashboard_insight_view USING btree (dashboard_id)

Indexes.Name: dashboard_insight_view_insight_view_id_fk_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX dashboard_insight_view_insight_view_id_fk_idx ON dashboard_insight_view USING btree (insight_view_id)

Constraints.Name: dashboard_insight_view_dashboard_id_fk
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (dashboard_id) REFERENCES dashboard(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

Constraints.Name: dashboard_insight_view_insight_view_id_fk
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (insight_view_id) REFERENCES insight_view(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

Tables.Name: insight_dirty_queries
Tables.Comment: Stores queries that were unsuccessful or otherwise flagged as incomplete or incorrect.

Columns.Name: dirty_at
Columns.Comment: Timestamp when this query was marked dirty.

Columns.Name: for_time
Columns.Comment: Timestamp for which the original data point was recorded or intended to be recorded.

Columns.Name: query
Columns.Comment: Sourcegraph query string that was executed.

Columns.Name: reason
Columns.Comment: Human readable string indicating the reason the query was marked dirty.

Indexes.Name: insight_dirty_queries_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX insight_dirty_queries_pkey ON insight_dirty_queries USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: insight_dirty_queries_insight_series_id_fk_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX insight_dirty_queries_insight_series_id_fk_idx ON insight_dirty_queries USING btree (insight_series_id)

Constraints.Name: insight_dirty_queries_insight_series_id_fkey
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (insight_series_id) REFERENCES insight_series(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

Tables.Name: insight_series
Tables.Comment: Data series that comprise code insights.

Columns.Name: created_at
Columns.Comment: Timestamp when this series was created

Columns.Name: deleted_at
Columns.Comment: Timestamp of a soft-delete of this row.

Columns.Name: generation_method
Columns.Comment: Specifies the execution method for how this series is generated. This helps the system understand how to generate the time series data.

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: Primary key ID of this series

Columns.Name: just_in_time
Columns.Comment: Specifies if the series should be resolved just in time at query time, or recorded in background processing.

Columns.Name: last_recorded_at
Columns.Comment: Timestamp when this series was last recorded (non-historical).

Columns.Name: next_recording_after
Columns.Comment: Timestamp when this series should next record (non-historical).

Columns.Name: oldest_historical_at
Columns.Comment: Timestamp representing the oldest point of which this series is backfilled.

Columns.Name: query
Columns.Comment: Query string that generates this series

Columns.Name: series_id
Columns.Comment: Timestamp that this series completed a full repository iteration for backfill. This flag has limited semantic value, and only means it tried to queue up queries for each repository. It does not guarantee success on those queries.

Indexes.Name: insight_series_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX insight_series_pkey ON insight_series USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: insight_series_series_id_unique_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX insight_series_series_id_unique_idx ON insight_series USING btree (series_id)

Indexes.Name: insight_series_deleted_at_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX insight_series_deleted_at_idx ON insight_series USING btree (deleted_at)

Indexes.Name: insight_series_next_recording_after_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX insight_series_next_recording_after_idx ON insight_series USING btree (next_recording_after)

Tables.Name: insight_view
Tables.Comment: Views for insight data series. An insight view is an abstraction on top of an insight data series that allows for lightweight modifications to filters or metadata without regenerating the underlying series.

Columns.Name: description
Columns.Comment: Description of the view. This may render in a chart depending on the view type.

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: Primary key ID for this view

Columns.Name: other_threshold
Columns.Comment: Percent threshold for grouping series under "other"

Columns.Name: presentation_type
Columns.Comment: The basic presentation type for the insight view. (e.g Line, Pie, etc.)

Columns.Name: title
Columns.Comment: Title of the view. This may render in a chart depending on the view type.

Columns.Name: unique_id
Columns.Comment: Globally unique identifier for this view that is externally referencable.

Indexes.Name: insight_view_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX insight_view_pkey ON insight_view USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: insight_view_unique_id_unique_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX insight_view_unique_id_unique_idx ON insight_view USING btree (unique_id)

Tables.Name: insight_view_grants
Tables.Comment: Permission grants for insight views. Each row should represent a unique principal (user, org, etc).

Columns.Name: global
Columns.Comment: Grant that does not belong to any specific principal and is granted to all users.

Columns.Name: org_id
Columns.Comment: Org ID that that receives this grant.

Columns.Name: user_id
Columns.Comment: User ID that that receives this grant.

Indexes.Name: insight_view_grants_pk
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX insight_view_grants_pk ON insight_view_grants USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: insight_view_grants_global_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX insight_view_grants_global_idx ON insight_view_grants USING btree (global) WHERE global IS TRUE

Indexes.Name: insight_view_grants_insight_view_id_index
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX insight_view_grants_insight_view_id_index ON insight_view_grants USING btree (insight_view_id)

Indexes.Name: insight_view_grants_org_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX insight_view_grants_org_id_idx ON insight_view_grants USING btree (org_id)

Indexes.Name: insight_view_grants_user_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX insight_view_grants_user_id_idx ON insight_view_grants USING btree (user_id)

Constraints.Name: insight_view_grants_insight_view_id_fk
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (insight_view_id) REFERENCES insight_view(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

Tables.Name: insight_view_series
Tables.Comment: Join table to correlate data series with insight views

Columns.Name: insight_series_id
Columns.Comment: Foreign key to insight data series.

Columns.Name: insight_view_id
Columns.Comment: Foreign key to insight view.

Columns.Name: label
Columns.Comment: Label text for this data series. This may render in a chart depending on the view type.

Columns.Name: stroke
Columns.Comment: Stroke color metadata for this data series. This may render in a chart depending on the view type.

Indexes.Name: insight_view_series_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX insight_view_series_pkey ON insight_view_series USING btree (insight_view_id, insight_series_id)

Constraints.Name: insight_view_series_insight_view_id_fkey
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (insight_view_id) REFERENCES insight_view(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

Tables.Name: metadata
Tables.Comment: Records arbitrary metadata about events. Stored in a separate table as it is often repeated for multiple events.

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: The metadata ID.

Columns.Name: metadata
Columns.Comment: Metadata about some event, this can be any arbitrary JSON emtadata which will be returned when querying events, and can be filtered on and grouped using jsonb operators ?, ?&, ?|, and @>. This should be small data only.

Indexes.Name: metadata_metadata_unique_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX metadata_metadata_unique_idx ON metadata USING btree (metadata)

Indexes.Name: metadata_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX metadata_pkey ON metadata USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: metadata_metadata_gin
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX metadata_metadata_gin ON metadata USING gin (metadata)

Indexes.Name: migration_logs_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX migration_logs_pkey ON migration_logs USING btree (id)

Tables.Name: repo_names
Tables.Comment: Records repository names, both historical and present, using a unique repository _name_ ID (unrelated to the repository ID.)

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: The repository _name_ ID.

Columns.Name: name
Columns.Comment: The repository name string, with unique constraint for table entry deduplication and trigram index for e.g. regex filtering.

Indexes.Name: repo_names_name_unique_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX repo_names_name_unique_idx ON repo_names USING btree (name)

Indexes.Name: repo_names_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX repo_names_pkey ON repo_names USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: repo_names_name_trgm
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX repo_names_name_trgm ON repo_names USING gin (lower(name::text) gin_trgm_ops)

Tables.Name: series_points
Tables.Comment: Records events over time associated with a repository (or none, i.e. globally) where a single numerical value is going arbitrarily up and down.  Repository association is based on both repository ID and name. The ID can be used to refer toa specific repository, or lookup the current name of a repository after it has been e.g. renamed. The name can be used to refer to the name of the repository at the time of the events creation, for example to trace the change in a gauge back to a repository being renamed.

Columns.Name: metadata_id
Columns.Comment: Associated metadata for this event, if any.

Columns.Name: original_repo_name_id
Columns.Comment: The repository name as it was known at the time the event was created. It may have been renamed since.

Columns.Name: repo_id
Columns.Comment: The repository ID (from the main application DB) at the time the event was created. Note that the repository may no longer exist / be valid at query time, however.

Columns.Name: repo_name_id
Columns.Comment: The most recently known name for the repository, updated periodically to account for e.g. repository renames. If the repository was deleted, this is still the most recently known name.  null if the event was not for a single repository (i.e. a global gauge).

Columns.Name: series_id
Columns.Comment: A unique identifier for the series of data being recorded. This is not an ID from another table, but rather just a unique identifier.

Columns.Name: time
Columns.Comment: The timestamp of the recorded event.

Columns.Name: value
Columns.Comment: The floating point value at the time of the event.

Indexes.Name: series_points_original_repo_name_id_btree
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_original_repo_name_id_btree ON series_points USING btree (original_repo_name_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_repo_id_btree
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_repo_id_btree ON series_points USING btree (repo_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_repo_name_id_btree
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_repo_name_id_btree ON series_points USING btree (repo_name_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_series_id_btree
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_series_id_btree ON series_points USING btree (series_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_series_id_repo_id_time_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_series_id_repo_id_time_idx ON series_points USING btree (series_id, repo_id, "time")

Constraints.Name: check_repo_fields_specifity
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: CHECK (repo_id IS NULL AND repo_name_id IS NULL AND original_repo_name_id IS NULL OR repo_id IS NOT NULL AND repo_name_id IS NOT NULL AND original_repo_name_id IS NOT NULL)

Constraints.Name: series_points_metadata_id_fkey
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (metadata_id) REFERENCES metadata(id) ON DELETE CASCADE DEFERRABLE

Constraints.Name: series_points_original_repo_name_id_fkey
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (original_repo_name_id) REFERENCES repo_names(id) ON DELETE CASCADE DEFERRABLE

Constraints.Name: series_points_repo_name_id_fkey
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (repo_name_id) REFERENCES repo_names(id) ON DELETE CASCADE DEFERRABLE

Tables.Name: series_points_snapshots
Tables.Comment: Stores ephemeral snapshot data of insight recordings.

Indexes.Name: series_points_snapshots_original_repo_name_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_snapshots_original_repo_name_id_idx ON series_points_snapshots USING btree (original_repo_name_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_snapshots_repo_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_snapshots_repo_id_idx ON series_points_snapshots USING btree (repo_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_snapshots_repo_name_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_snapshots_repo_name_id_idx ON series_points_snapshots USING btree (repo_name_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_snapshots_series_id_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_snapshots_series_id_idx ON series_points_snapshots USING btree (series_id)

Indexes.Name: series_points_snapshots_series_id_repo_id_time_idx
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX series_points_snapshots_series_id_repo_id_time_idx ON series_points_snapshots USING btree (series_id, repo_id, "time")

Constraints.Name: check_repo_fields_specifity
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: CHECK (repo_id IS NULL AND repo_name_id IS NULL AND original_repo_name_id IS NULL OR repo_id IS NOT NULL AND repo_name_id IS NOT NULL AND original_repo_name_id IS NOT NULL)
